skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: 7Spade

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation and utility skill for creating other skills. It contains Python scripts for skill initialization, validation, and packaging. All scripts operate locally on filesystem, create directories and files at user-specified paths, and make no network calls or external command executions. No sensitive data access detected.

content.value_statement: Building specialized skills for Claude requires understanding skill structure and best practices. This skill provides templates, validation tools, and step-by-step guidance for creating effective skills that extend Claude with domain expertise and custom workflows.
actual_capabilities: Initialize new skill directories with SKILL.md template
Validate skill structure and frontmatter requirements
Provide best practices for skill design and organization
Guide progressive disclosure patterns for context management
Document workflow and output patterns for effective skills
limitations: Does not execute user code or interact with external APIs
Cannot install skills into Claude automatically
Only provides guidance and templates, not runtime execution
Scripts must be run locally by the user

use_cases.title: Build Custom Skills
use_cases.description: Create specialized skills to customize Claude for specific domains or tasks

use_cases.title: Standardize Team Workflows
use_cases.description: Package team processes and best practices into reusable skills

use_cases.title: Share Domain Knowledge
use_cases.description: Distribute company-specific knowledge and procedures across your organization

prompt_templates.title: Create New Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the skill-creator skill to help me create a new skill called [skill-name] for [use case]. Walk me through the skill creation process.

prompt_templates.title: Validate Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my skill at [path] using the quick_validate script. Report any issues and how to fix them.

prompt_templates.title: Package Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Package my skill at [path] into a .skill file. Where should I put the output?

prompt_templates.title: Design Patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me examples of effective skill structures from the workflow patterns and output patterns references.

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for writing documentation
output: Files generated: SKILL.md, scripts/example.py, references/api_reference.md, assets/example_asset.txt
Next steps: Edit SKILL.md with your documentation workflow and requirements

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md concise and focused on what Claude needs to know
Use progressive disclosure to load detailed content only when needed
Include executable scripts for deterministic, repeatable operations
anti_patterns: Including redundant documentation that Claude already knows
Creating deeply nested reference files that are hard to discover
Adding user-facing documentation files like README inside the skill

faq.question: What tools support .skill files?
faq.answer: Claude, Codex, and Claude Code can load .skill files to extend their capabilities with specialized knowledge.

faq.question: What is the maximum size for a skill?
faq.answer: SKILL.md body should stay under 500 lines. Bundled resources have no practical limit since scripts execute without loading into context.

faq.question: Can I include Python dependencies?
faq.answer: Skills include scripts that run locally. Users must have required dependencies installed in their environment.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using skills?
faq.answer: Skills only access files you explicitly provide. This skill makes no network calls and accesses only local files.

faq.question: Why is my validation failing?
faq.answer: Check that SKILL.md has valid YAML frontmatter with name and description. Names must be hyphen-case, max 64 characters.

faq.question: How is this different from system prompts?
faq.answer: Skills are modular packages that can be shared and loaded on demand. They bundle resources like scripts and references.
